text: A hyperoperation is a generalization of addition, multiplication, exponentiation, tetration, etc. They are often written using Knuth's up-arrow notation. Natural number level hyperoperations can be defined recursively as a piecewise function: : H_n(a, b) = \begin{cases} b + 1 & \text{if } n = 0 \\\ a & \text{if } n = 1, b = 0 \\\ 0 & \text{if } n = 2, b = 0 \\\ 1 & \text{if } n \ge 3, b = 0 \\\ H_{n-1}(a, H_n(a, b - 1)) & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}\,\\! Category:Hyperoperations This is used to express really large numbers while being able to write them.
title: Hyperoperation
